articles.title: Renault braced for more pain in Bahrain
articles.description: Renault have warned Red Bull and Toro Rosso to expect more pain in Bahrain after both Formula One teams suffered power unit problems in China on Sunday.

articles.title: Anna Karolina Schmiedlova claims first WTA title
articles.description: Schmiedlova claimed her first WTA title and deprived Camila Giorgi her own milestone with a 6-4 6-3 victory in the Katowice Open final.

articles.title: Mario Mandzukic fit for Real Madrid clash in Champions League
articles.description: Mandzukic has recovered from a right foot injury in time for the Champions League quarter-final against Real Madrid.

articles.title: Chelsea fortunate to win, but Jose Mourinho does not care
articles.description: Fabregas's goal was their only attempt on target and Chelsea had their lowest pass completion rate of the season.

articles.title: Celebrities praise Sania Mirza on twitter
articles.description: Mahesh Bhupathi, who along with Leander Paes had become the world number in men's tennis in 90s, praised Sania on his twitter page.

articles.title: Sania Mirza creates history, becomes World No. 1 player in doubles
articles.description: The top-seeded Indo-Swiss pair blew away the challenge of Dellacqua-Jurak 6-0 6-4 in the lop-sided final of the WTA Family Circle Cup.

articles.title: New Zealand stop Australia juggernaut to win 2nd Azlan Shah title
articles.description: Goalkeeper Devon Manchester starred for the Black Sticks under the woodwork to secure the hard-earned win in the shoot-out against defending champions Australia.

articles.title: I-League: Lajong FC, Royal Wahingdoh play out 1-1 draw
articles.description: Youngster Nim Dorjee Tamang scored for Lajong while Kim scored the late equaliser for Royal Wahingdoh at the JN Stadium.

articles.title: Jenson Button handed time penalty for Pastor Maldonado collision
articles.description: Button, who dropped to 14th as a result of the extra five seconds added to his time, also picked up two penalty points for the turn one collision.

articles.title: Manchester United end recent derby pain with 4-2 win over Manchester City
articles.description: United's sixth straight league win came despite the soon-to-be-deposed champions going ahead through Sergio Aguero's eighth-minute opener.

articles.title: EPL: Cesc Fabregas strikes late as Chelsea beat QPR 1-0
articles.description: A mishit clearance by QPR goalkeeper Robert Green was picked up by Eden Hazard and the Belgium winger fed Fabregas for a low finish inside the post.

articles.title: IPTL 2015 draft: Indian Aces snare Nadal, Leander to new team Japan Warriors
articles.description: Federer came to the Indian side in the inaugural edition after Nadal's pull out and this time British star Andy Murray will not be part of any side.

articles.title: Arsene Wenger heaps praise on Arsenal defence after Burnley win
articles.description: It was Arsenal's fourth clean sheet in their eight-game winning streak and the manager was impressed by his team's resilience.

articles.title: Diego Simeone's knowledge of Atletico Madrid's weaknesses key: Fernando Torres
articles.description: Torres believes coach Simeone's clear understanding of the team's weaknesses has been the key to their success as they seek revenge against Real Madrid.

articles.title: Hockey: India claim Sultan Azlan Shah bronze beating South Korea on penalties
articles.description: India outclassed the Koreans 4-1 in shootout after the regulation period of the third-place playoff in Ipoh, Malaysia, ended 2-2.

articles.title: Hockey: We learnt lessons in Azlan Shah Cup, says Paul van Ass
articles.description: Van Ass said that the 24th Azlan Shah Cup was a platform to gather knowledge about the team and the past one week has been a great leaning curve for the boys.

articles.title: Ferrari keeps pressure on Mercedes at Chinese Grand Prix
articles.description: Ferrari's Vettel stayed close to the Mercedes cars of Lewis Hamilton and Nico Rosberg while running on soft tires for the first half of the race.

articles.title: Hockey midfielder Dharamvir Singh reaches 100-international cap milestone
articles.description: Dharamvir Singh achieved the milestone during India's 4-2 win against Australia in a Sultan Azlan Shah Cup league match on Saturday.

articles.title: No points for Force India in Shanghai
articles.description: Sergio Perez though did a good job by getting close to points bracket after starting 15th from the grid.

articles.title: Barcelona need to rediscover defensive solidity for title charge
articles.description: Barcelona need to rediscover the defensively solidity alongside their sharp attack after an error by Pique in the drawn match against Sevilla.

articles.title: Japanes Kento Momota wins Singapore Open men's singles title
articles.description: Momota beat Hong Kong's Hu Yun 21-17, 16-21, 21-15 in a match that lasted almost 80 minutes at the Singapore Indoor Stadium.

articles.title: Mateo Musacchio injures ankle in Villarreal draw at Getafe
articles.description: Musacchio suffered a gruesome ankle injury near the end of a 1-1 draw at Getafe in the Spanish league on Sunday.

articles.title: Arsenal CEO 'not happy' with season, top 4 to become harder
articles.description: Arsenal CEO Gazidis says the Premier League is "going to become more competitive which is going to be more challenging for clubs like us."

articles.title: As it happened: Sultan Azlan Shah Cup, India vs South Korea, bronze medal playoff
articles.description: India outclassed the Koreans 4-1 in shootout after the regulation period of the third-place playoff in Ipoh, Malaysia, ended 2-2.

articles.title: Sao Paulo goalkeeper scores 127th goal to extend record
articles.description: The legendary Brazilian keeper claimed his 127th career strike with his team's opening goal against RB Brasil on Saturday with a free kick.

articles.title: Manchester United offer Robin van Persie 5 million pounds to leave club
articles.description: Van Persie moved to Manchester United back in 2012 when the Dutchman was bought for 24 million pounds from Arsenal.

articles.title: Lewis Hamilton cruises to 4th Chinese Grand Prix victory
articles.description: Hamilton extended his lead at the top of the Formula One championship standings with a pole-to-flag victory on Sunday.

articles.title: Sania Mirza one win away from becoming No 1 doubles player
articles.description: Hingis and Mirza beat 6-4, 1-6, 10-7 Kudryavtseva and Pavlyuchenkova to reach the final of the Family Circle Cup tennis tournament.

articles.title: Indian women lose 2-4 to US in Hawke's Bay Cup hockey
articles.description: Anuradha Thokchom's brace failed to lift the Indian team as the US responded with goals from Witmer, Sharkey and Reinprecht.

articles.title: Sam Querrey, Jack Sock reach Clay Court final
articles.description: Querrey upset Verdasco 7-5, 2-6, 6-4 and Sock knocked off Anderson 7-6 (3), 6-3 to set set up the first all-American final in the Clay Court Championship.

articles.title: Jitu Rai wins bronze at ISSF World Cup in Korea
articles.description: Jitu aggregated a total of 181.1 points to finish third on the podium, missing out on the gold medal shoot-out by 0.4 points.

articles.title: Greg Norman feels sorry for fallen Tiger Woods
articles.description: "I do feel sorry for Tiger, where he's sitting at the moment. I hate seeing someone who, at the pinnacle, can fall off and look so disgustingly bad," said Norman.

articles.title: Madison Keys to play for Family Circle title against Angelique Kerber
articles.description: Keys reached the Family Circle Cup final with a dominating, 6-1, 6-4 victory over Hradecka.

articles.title: Camila Giorgi beats Agnieszka Radwanska to reach Katowice Open final
articles.description: Giorgi upset home favorite Radwanska 6-4, 6-2 in the semi-finals of the Katowice Open to face Schmiedlova in the final.

articles.title: Usain Bolt keen on Justin Gatlin showdown any time
articles.description: "I never have a problem competing as long as I know that I'm in great shape and I'm getting there," Bolt said after running a 200 metres race.

articles.title: Manchester derby: United and City to battle it out for the 3rd place in EPL
articles.description: City have won the last four league meetings against United, including a 1-0 victory at the Etihad Stadium in November, but their hopes of retaining the title have faded.

articles.title: Anirban Lahiri 51st after third round in Masters
articles.description: Lahiri carded two-over 74 to take the 51st position after the third round in the Masters Tournament.

articles.title: Jordan Spieth sets another Masters record, has 4-shot lead
articles.description: Speith made four birdies in five holes on the back nine to stretch his lead to seven shots to seize control of the Masters.
